IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO CONSERVE THE UNIQUE PLANT AND ANIMAL HABITAT, CLEAN WATER, FARMLAND, SCENIC BEAUTY, AND PLACES FOR PEOPLE TO ENJOY OUTDOOR RECREATION IN THE MOUNTAINS OF NORTH CAROLINA AND TENNESSEE FOR THE BENEFIT OF PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To conserve the unique plant and animal habitat, clean water, farmland, scenic beauty,
IRS990.Desc: OVER THE PAST FISCAL YEAR WE COMPLETED 16 MAJOR CONSERVATION TRANSACTIONS DISCUSSED BELOW WHICH PROTECTED 2,729 ACRES OF KEY MOUNTAIN LANDS. THIS INCLUDES 12 FEE SIMPLE PURCHASES AND 4 CONSERVATION EASEMENT PURCHASES. THE TOTAL APPRAISED VALUE OF THESE TRANSACTIONS WAS $10.5 MILLION. LANDOWNER DONATION VALUE WAS $4.1 MILLION. THE PURCHASE PRICE OF THE TRANSACTIONS WAS $5.9 MILLION. AT TIMES THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASES LAND BELOW APPRAISED VALUE IN TRANSACTIONS THAT WERE NOT PLANNED TO BE BARGAIN PURCHASES. IN THIS TAX YEAR THAT DIFFERENCE TOTALED $0.5 MILLION. THE $5.9 MILLION CAME IN THE FORM OF PRIVATE PHILANTHROPIC CONTRIBUTIONS AND FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS. WE ARE NOW WORKING ON MORE THAN 20 SIGNIFICANT TRANSACTIONS, WHICH WE HOPE WILL PROTECT ANOTHER 2,900 ACRES IN THE NEXT 12-18 MONTHS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: OUR FARMLAND ACCESS PROGRAM SUPPORTS LOCAL COMMUNITIES, LOCAL FOOD PRODUCTION, AND THE LONG-TERM PRODUCTIVE USE OF FARMLAND. WE WORK WITH DIFFERENT MEMBERS OF THE FARMING COMMUNITY TO ENSURE THAT OUR AGRICULTURAL RESOURCES STAY PRODUCTIVE - PROVIDING LOCAL FOOD FROM LOCAL FARMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SAHC has a conservation easement monitoring & enforcement policy that's been adopted based on guidelines set forth by the Land Trust Alliance through its accreditation process. Monitoring is performed by a Land Stewardship Coordinator. SAHC has enforcement capability & maintains a legal defense fund.

SAHC's policy related to reporting of conservation easements as stated in the audit is as follows: Easements received by donation are not recognized in assets or in income, and easements purchased are expensed.
To generate income for conservation easement stewardship, land acquisition and other conservation purposes consistent with the purpose and terms of each endowment fund.

SAHC is exempt from Federal income taxes under 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Under the Code, income from certain activities not related to the organization's tax-exempt purpose may be subject to taxation as unrelated business income. The organization believes that it has appropriate support for all tax positions taken, and as such, does not have any uncertain tax positions that are material to the financial statements.
Rental Expense $15,421, Fundraising Expense $4,889, Raffle Expense $11,311, Merchandise Expense $826
Rental Expense $15,421, Fundraising Expense $4,889, Raffle Expense $11,311, Merchandise Expense $826

Blue Ridge Forever is a coalition of land conservation organizations in the Southern Blue Ridge formed to engage the public and raise financial resources to safeguard land & water in the Southern Blue Ridge for present & future generations. SAHC is the administrating organization for the project and as such has monitoring responsibilities. Each organization must go through an application process, a selection process by the steering committee and each group must complete a grant agreement that contains the following:
RESPONSIBILITIES: The Subgrantee is to use the funds in accordance with their approved subgrant application.
SUBGRANT PERIOD: grant period is scheduled to end xxx date. All subgrant funds should be expended between XXX date and XXX date.

REPORTS: The Subgrantee agrees to prepare and deliver to Blue Ridge Forever a report on the use of these funds on the attached form by xxx, date to be collectively submitted to the Grantors for all activity under the grant as required by Grantor.

Accounting Practices: The Subgrantee must adhere to generally accepted accounting principles in maintaining accurate, current and complete records. Upon request, the Subgrantee shall permit authorized representatives from SAHC or the Grantor to inspect and/or have audited all work, materials, payrolls, records, and other data with respect to the Subgrantee's operations and expenditure of grant funds provided under this contract. The Subgrantee shall have adequate internal controls to insure protection of all assets. As a condition of this Contract for Services, Subgrantee acknowledges and agrees that the following specific accounting practices shall be observed: (1) The Subgrantee's books and bank statements are reconciled monthly. Expenditures of Subgrantee funds are subject to a formal review and approval process. (2) The Subgrantee's Board of Directors approves a formal annual budget. (3) The Subgrantee's accounting policies provide for documentation of expenditures. Such documentation includes invoices and receipts from vendors verifying that goods and services were delivered and paid for. The Subgrantee agrees to retain all records supporting the disbursement of grant funds for a period of five (5) years, and bank account records for a period of five (5) years.
SAHC does not carry conservation easements as assets on the organization's books. Accordingly, donated conservation easements are not recognized as revenue.

At the annual membership meeting, a group of prescreened trustees are voted on by members either in person or by proxy. Members may abstain from voting or vote for or against. This vote is the extent of the membership rights. Members do not have control over day-to-day governance decisions. However, if there would be significant changes to the organization, such as a merger, dissolution, or amendment to the Articles of Incorporation, members may vote on such issues.
The 990 is prepared by independent accountants, reviewed by management, presented to the Finance Committee for review, and once approved, presented to the entire Board for review and comment.

All Trustee members and staff must sign an annual conflict of interest statement acknowledging that they understand the policy and procedures. As part of this policy there is a disclosure procedure if there is knowledge of a possible conflict of interest.

In the annual budgeting process, the Board approves a budget line for aggregate salary expense. Thereafter, individual salaries and salary increases for employees are determined by the Executive Director. The Board of Directors sets the Executive Director salary after a performance review and a check of comparable salary information for nonprofit organizations with similar budgets.
Forms 1023 & 990 are available upon request.
Governing documents, conflict of interest policy & financial statements are available upon request.
